news_header: Las Vegas real estate prices hit record highs in September 2024, with condos and townhomes reaching an all-time high while single-family home prices nearly matched their peak.
news_text: A report by Las Vegas Realtors indicates that in September 2024, the median price of single-family homes in Southern Nevada rose to $479,900, a 6.6% increase from the previous year, while condo and townhome prices reached $299,500, up 10.9%. Despite these price increases, the number of homes listed without offers surged, with single-family homes up 34.2% and condos/townhomes up 67.2% compared to last year. Overall sales of existing homes decreased slightly by 1.6%, with cash transactions also declining. Distressed sales remained low at 0.8% of total sales. These statistics reflect the market activity through September 2024.
